alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; St. Clair; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 3:45PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN TALLADEGA...WESTERN CALHOUN AND CENTRAL ST. CLAIR COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM CST... At 345 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Odenville to Pell City to near Logan Martin Dam. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Talladega, Pell City, Springville, Odenville, Lincoln, Ashville, Riverside, Vincent, Ragland, Munford, Ohatchee, Alpine Bay Resort, Talladega Superspeedway, Harrisburg, Talladega Municipal Airport, Logan Martin Lake, Honda Manufacturing Of Alabama, Coosa Island, Bynum, and Neely Henry Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
